title: Audit events
content:
The topic describes the events that trigger the generation of audit log records. Note that these events can take place either from the UI or through API calls.

The Audit UI has two tabs:  

  • System: This tab displays system events. To view system events, users must have system-level audit view permission.
  • Tenant: This tab displays tenant events. To view tenant events, users must have tenant-level audit view permission.

In the following tables, the Event type columns use the following conventions:

  • Tenant: Tenant events that are visible to tenant users with the tenant-level audit view permission. Normally, these users are the tenant admin or tenant auditor. 
  • System for tenant: System events that have happened to the tenant and are visible to users with the system-level audit view permission. Normally, these users are the suite administrator, tenant admin, or auditor.
  • System: System events that are visible to users with the system-level audit view permission. Normally these users are the suite administrator or auditor. 

IdM events

Event name Comments Target Additional information in the Description field Event type
User.Logon Success or failure of user logon activities, including password expiration and exceeding of maximum sessions (for DB users only). User UPN Authorization type Tenant
User.Logout Success or failure of user logout activities with SAML/OAUTH authentication. User UPN Authorization type Tenant
Account.Activate & Account.Deactivate Success or failure of user account activation or deactivation. User UPN N/A System for tenant
Password.Change Success or failure of password change  (for DB users only). User UPN N/A Tenant
Organization.Change Success or failure of creating or deleting an organization, or updating an organization's metadata. Organization ID N/A System
User.Change Success or failure of creating, updating, or deleting a user. User UPN N/A Tenant
User.Change Success or failure of adding or removing a user from a group. User UPN N/A Tenant

User.Change

Success or failure of TOTP binding, unbinding, or verification for a DB user.

User UPN

N/A

 Tenant
Group.Change Success or failure of creating, updating, or deleting a group. Group UPN N/A System for tenant
Group.Representation.Change Success or failure of creating, updating, or deleting a group representation. Group representation name N/A System for tenant
Role.Change Success or failure of creating, updating, or deleting a role. Role name N/A System for tenant
User.Role.Change Success or failure of adding a role to or removing a role from a user. User UPN Updated role list of the user System for tenant
Group.Role.Change Success or failure of adding a role to or removing a role from a group. Group UPN Updated role list of the group System for tenant
Permission.Change Success or failure of adding, removing, or updating permission (only eligible for API). Permission name N/A System for tenant
Setting.Change Success or failure of changing a system setting. Setting name

New value of the setting.

Note that the Audit feature doesn't record the new value for any string type setting to avoid disclosing sensitive data.

 System
Authentication.Change Success or failure of adding, removing, or updating an authentication. Authentication name N/A System for tenant
Authentication.Group.Change Success or failure of adding or removing an authentication group. Authentication group name N/A System for tenant

Agent interface events

Event name Comments Target Additional information in the Description field Event type
Setting.Change Successful changes to application settings (Administration > Application settings, Administration > Service Portal Settings > Feature Settings), including some tenant application settings made through Suite Administration.

Setting name (key)

For example: ENABLE_FOLLOWER

New value of the setting

Note that the Audit feature doesn't record the new value for any string type setting to avoid disclosing sensitive data.

 Tenant
Entitlement Rule.Change Successful changes to entitlement rules (Administration > Master Data > People > Entitlement Rules). This includes creating new records and updating or deleting existing records. Entitlement rule ID N/A Tenant
[entity type].Change

Successful change made by adding an entitlement rule to or removing an entitlement rule from a catalog, service definition, offering, or article.

 Record type and ID The ID of the added or removed entitlement rule Tenant
Person/Group.Change

Successful change of the roles of a person or group.

 UPN of the person or group Updated role list of the person or group Tenant
Data.Access Unauthorized attempts to access OData. Desensitized OData token N/A Tenant
Data.Access

Rejected unauthorized access to EMS records or associations.

Record type for Read or Create rejection

Record type and ID for Update or Delete rejection

Or

Source record type and ID and target record type and ID of a relationship for Create or Delete rejection

 N/A Tenant
Data.Export

Successful export data from a record type grid.

Note: Expense line, Notification history, report grid view, etc, are not supported.

 Record type The number of lines of data that was exported, the fields and filter(s) that were applied, and the name of the export file. Tenant
Application.Activate & Application.Deactivate Successful activation or deactivation of an application. Application name N/A Tenant
License.User.Change Success of updating the license for its entitled users. License ID Number of users entitled to the license Tenant
Role.Change Success of adding or updating a role. Role name N/A Tenant
Dev2Prod.Export Success of a Dev2Prod package export, including the total number of exported items. Tenant ID N/A Tenant
Dev2Prod.Import

Success or failure of a Dev2Prod package import, including the number of added/modified/failed/warning/removed items or the cause of the failure.

 Tenant ID N/A Tenant
Person.Profile.Change

Whether the user accepts or rejects the Aviator disclaimer.

Note: This event is only available to tenants that have enabled the Aviator capability.

 User UPN N/A Tenant

Suite administration events

Event name Comments Target Additional information in the Description field Event type
Tenant.Upgrade & Tenant.Crawling.Upgrade Tenant upgrade. Tenant ID Version, status, and start/end time of success upgrade. System
Setting.Change Successful security setting changes and license expiration notifications. Setting name or key

New value of the setting.
 

Note that the Audit feature doesn't record the new value for any string type setting to avoid disclosing sensitive data.

 System
User.Change Successful attaching of a user to a tenant or detaching a user from a tenant. User UPN N/A System for tenant
Tenant.Create, Tenant.Deploy, Tenant.Delete, Tenant.Activate & Tenant.Deactivate Tenant lifecycle events, including creation, deployment, activation, deactivation, and deletion. Tenant ID N/A System
Capability.Activate & Capability.Deactivate Success or failure of activating or deactivating a capability. Capability name N/A System for tenant
Tenant.Crawling.Upgrade Start of a crawling upgrade on the system. N/A N/A System
Tenant.Crawling.Upgrade Start of a crawling upgrade on the tenant. Tenant ID N/A System
Tenant.Export & Tenant.Import Success of exporting or importing a tenant. Source/Target tenant ID N/A System
License.Change Success of uploading a license to the system. System ID, edition, access type, and capacity System
License.Change Success of assigning a license to a tenant or revoking the license from a tenant. Tenant ID ID, edition, access type, and capacity System for tenant
License.Reconcile Success of reconciling a license. N/A N/A System

Service portal events

Event name Comments Target Additional information in the Description field Event type
Data.Access

Rejected unauthorized access to Service Portal based on service portal permissions, for example, entitlement rules. 

 REST API name N/A Tenant

UD/UCMDB audit events

Event name Comments Target Additional information in the Description field Event type
Setting.Change Successful changes to application settings  (Administration > Infrastructure Settings, or JMX console), including UCMDB customer settings or global application settings. Setting name The new value of the setting if it's boolean System for tenant or tenant
License.Change Successful license changes. License name N/A Tenant
User.Change Successful specific user changes, like name, description, email, etc. This includes adding or removing a user. User UPN N/A Tenant
Role.Change Successful role changes, like name or description. This includes adding or removing a role, and also permission changes to the role. Role name N/A Tenant
Group.Change Successful specific group changes, like description or name. This includes adding or removing a group. Group name N/A Tenant
User.Role.Change Successful role user changes. This includes adding or removing a role from a user. User UPN The role name that was assigned or removed Tenant
Group.Role.Change Successful group role changes. This includes adding or removing a role from a group. Group UPN The role name that was assigned or removed Tenant
User.Group.Change Successful user group changes. This includes adding or removing users from a group. Group UPN N/A Tenant
Class.Model.Change Successful Class Model changes, like description, attributes, etc. This includes adding or removing a CI Type from Class Model. CI Type name N/A Tenant
Package.Deploy Successful deployment of a resource package.  Package name The resources names that were added or updated Tenant
Package.Undeploy Successful undeployment of a resource package.  Package name The resources names that were removed Tenant
Tenant.Change Successful UD/UCMDB tenant changes, like name or description. This includes adding or removing a UD/UCMDB tenant. UD/UCMDB tenant ID N/A Tenant
Ucmdb.Login Successful login and logout. Application name N/A System for tenant or tenant
Invalid.Login Fail to login. Application name N/A Tenant
Customer.Create, Customer.Delete, Customer.Start & Customer.Stop Customer lifecycle events, including creation, deletion, starting-up, and stopping. UCMDB customer ID N/A System for tenant
JMX.Login Successful login and logout. Application name N/A System for tenant
Discovery adapter changes, Discovery script changes & Discovery configuration file changes Successful changes of Discovery adapter scripts and configuration files.
Discovery Adapter File name, Discovery Script name, and Discovery Configuration File name
 N/A Tenant

JMX methods:

  • exportCredentialsAndRangesInformation
  • importCredentialsAndRangesInformation
 Success or failure of exporting or importing the credentials and ranges information. Discovery Credentials and Ranges N/A System for tenant

REST API calls:

  • /discoveryintegration/export
  • /discoveryintegration/import
Success or failure of exporting or importing the discovery configuration. 
 Discovery Credentials and Ranges N/A System for tenant

REST API calls:

  • /dataflowmanagement/credentials/uda/{cm_credential_id}/export
  • /dataflowmanagement/ranges/export
  • DELETE /dataflowmanagement/credentials/{cm_credential_id}
  • PATCH /dataflowmanagement/credentials/{cm_credential_id}
 Success or failure of exporting, deleting, or updating the credentials or ranges.

Credential name
IP range 

 N/A System for tenant
Discovery.AddCredential, Discovery.UpdateCredential, and Discovery.DeleteCredential (UCMDB UI)
 Success or failure of adding, updating, or deleting a credential. The resource that was modified N/A System for tenant

Audit service events

Event name Comments Target Additional information in the Description field Event type
Data.Access Success of exporting events into CSV. Tenant ID CSV file name, total number of records, and filters Tenant
Tenant.Create & Tenant.Delete Success or failure of creating, triggering the deletion of, or deleting an audit tenant. Tenant ID N/A System
